intro: Menomphalus saharae, commonly known as the Saharan menomphalus, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Sahara Desert. It belongs to the family Menomphalaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that bloom in shades of white and pale yellow. The plant has adapted to survive in extreme desert conditions through a deep root system and reduced leaf surface area. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is often found in rocky crevices. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
